text: Doctor’s office. Bryan knocks at the door.
Doctor looks up from the desk.
Good morning. Please, come in.
Good morning, doctor.
Bryan sits down. Doctor looks concerned but friendly.
What seems to be the matter?
I have a sore throat, and it hurts when I swallow. I have a runny nose too.
Doctor takes notes on a clipboard.
I see. Do you also have a cough or a fever?
Yes, I have a little cough, but I don’t have a fever. I often sneeze too.
Doctor checks Bryan’s throat with a small flashlight.
How long have you had these symptoms?
Since yesterday morning. It got worse last night.
Do you feel tired?
Yes, a bit. I didn’t sleep very well because of my sore throat.
Let me check it. Please open your mouth and say “ahh.” Yes, your throat is red and a bit swollen.
Doctor uses a stethoscope, listens to Bryan’s chest. Bryan breathes deeply.
Now I’d like to listen to your chest. Please take a deep breath in. Now let it out. Good. Your lungs sound clear.
Doctor measures blood pressure.
I’ll also check your blood pressure. Please roll up your sleeve. Well, your blood pressure is normal. That’s good.
Doctor writes notes at the desk.
What do you think it is, doctor?
Don’t worry. It looks like you’ve caught a cold. Nothing serious. But you need some medicine too. You should drink warm tea with honey. Stay at home for a few days and rest as much as you can.
All right. Can I have a note for school, please?
Doctor writes the note and hands it to Bryan.
Of course. I’ll write an excuse note for three days.
Thank you.
You’re welcome. Take care and get well soon.
